pullRequest.body:
Currently Mathlib has the following definition for a symmetric Sequilinear map:
```
variable [CommSemiring R] [AddCommMonoid M] [Module R M] {I : R →+* R} {B : M →ₛₗ[I] M →ₗ[R] R}

/-- The proposition that a sesquilinear form is symmetric -/
def IsSymm (B : M →ₛₗ[I] M →ₗ[R] R) : Prop :=
  ∀ x y, I (B x y) = B y x
```
The problem with this definition is with generalising it to Sequilinear maps (e.g. the inner product on a Hilbert C*-module).

Previously (#18406) I attempted to define `IsSymm` as:
```
variable [AddCommMonoid M₁] [AddCommMonoid M] [CommSemiring R] [Module R M₁] [Module R M]
  {I : R →+* R} {J : M →+ M} {B : M₁ →ₛₗ[I] M₁ →ₗ[R] M}

/-- The proposition that a sesquilinear form is conjugate symmetric -/
def IsConjSymm (B : M₁ →ₛₗ[I] M₁ →ₗ[R] M) (J : M →+ M) : Prop :=
  ∀ x y, J (B x y) = B y x
```
However, this definition met with [concern](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18406/files#r1821662467):
> I worry this is more generality than we really care about, and maybe we just want to allow I = J = star. Rather than changing anything here, it's probably best to discuss on Zulip.

I opened a [discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Linear.2EIsSymm.20for.20sesquilinear.20maps) on Zulip but didn't get any further feedback.

This PR is an attempt to move the discussion on by refactoring the definition for sesquilinear forms in terms of `star`.

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

pullRequest.title: refactor(LinearAlgebra/SesquilinearForm): Define IsSymm using star
